skos:Concept.skos:definition: {"id": "acef0c75-8072-4850-8b26-dee167d7361b", "value": "[S.] var. a\u1e63\u1e6dama\u1e45gal, astamangal; n. The Eight Auspicious Symbols consisting of Parasol (sit\u0101tapatra), Fish (kanakamatsya), Vase (nidhigha\u1e6da), Lotus (padma), conch (\u015ba\u1e45khavarta), Endless Knot (\u015br\u012bvatsa), Victory Banner (kundadhvaja) and All-Powerful Wheel (suvar\u1e47acakra). The Eight Auspicious Symbols may vary in different traditions. For example, \u015br\u012bvatsa, v\u0101ladhi or c\u0101mara, a\u1e45ku\u015ba, m\u012bna, nandin or svastika, ve\u1e63\u1e6dhana or bhadrap\u012b\u1e6dha, \u015ba\u1e45kha or gha\u1e6d\u0101yudha are the Eight Auspicious Symbols of the ancient Sinhalese."}
{"id": "0867768a-6a6e-4286-b63d-9695c663efe6", "value": "[New.] n. 1) courtyard, backyard (of a monastery), 2) park, place for public recreation."}
{"id": "ed7d85d2-c668-4d7d-96b8-dd7f3cecdc0a", "value": "[S.]; n. posture showed by \u015a\u0101kyamuni Buddha which will be adopted by the future Buddha, Maitreya."}
{"id": "0a4f925d-c413-490a-8f9e-6d89b2407234", "value": "[Fr. New. tun\u0101si\u0303] var. \u1e6dur\u0101l, \u1e6du\u1e0d\u0101l; n. the wooden support for the eaves or projecting edge of a roof."}

{"id": "b1ac4ff9-3780-48cf-90a9-6d2c3c20e4f3", "value": "[New.] n. 1) ceremonial phalc\u0101 (rest house), 2) kind of gu\u1e6dh\u012b building, night shelter for the image of a deity during a procession, 2) hut used for gu\u1e6dh\u012b feasts."}
{"id": "a5709ca4-1aed-4188-8dad-0fd1d818f68c", "value": "[S.] n. meditation gesture, the left hand is placed in the lap and the palm up."}
{"id": "e338123a-99c1-4b4c-8b54-bc1a2d582bcb", "value": "n. wooden tub for washing or feeding."}
{"id": "5eecc21d-bd01-4d1c-b59a-ce390101bb1e", "value": "[F. S.] n. A platform raised round the sacred plant, ocimum basilicum (tulas\u012b)."}
{"id": "9ae06edf-60b7-49f9-995e-90523a2b6b95", "value": "n. measuring rod (one yard)."}
{"id": "3983fd8b-3843-49c2-b58c-8bb9101422d4", "value": "[New.] n. branch or subdivision."}

{"id": "840f5e84-17ec-4805-9b15-0e2b36f21005", "value": "n. 1) skull covered by gold or silver used in tantric rituals to put ritual elements such as, alcohol, 2) ceremonial bowl of brass or silver."}
{"id": "14a30aa3-2c8d-46dc-92dc-dcc53e53b5da", "value": "n. private passage to a courtyard."}
{"id": "3028971b-d7cb-4e96-a7a4-f6d176b013bb", "value": "n anim blacksmith (caste)."}
{"id": "49dd9df4-2a5a-483c-8d09-5666d2b35091", "value": "n. dovetail joint. "}
{"id": "4764d1d6-5032-400c-82d4-a57f4ed25f04", "value": "[New.] n. thread to mark a line on wood."}

{"id": "9ae0be63-e049-42d1-a564-43831fb971c7", "value": "n. a necklace of 'nuts'. It is a rosary made of rudr\u0101k\u1e63a beads (Elaeocarpus ganitrus or its berries). The number of beads may vary from 32, 54, 64 or 108. "}
{"id": "53eab90e-a14e-421e-8c7e-e81f19971808", "value": "n. rounded chisel (carving)."}

{"id": "91e0d697-7b67-47f7-928d-5ca52189db5e", "value": "var. bande luigu; n. The initiation ritual of \u015a\u0101kyas and Vajr\u0101c\u0101ryas performed on every male child, which officially recognizes him as a member of the sa\u1e45gha of the respective b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25."}
{"id": "17521dbb-f58d-4598-880f-8cf722baf96b", "value": "n. Buddhist monastery with several rooms."}
{"id": "dd0a58fc-d6e0-4f40-a125-e4b1081b06de", "value": "n. 1) plank above the joists. 2) flooring plank; parquet. 3) wooden trowel. "}
{"id": "53712a5c-ce08-4bfb-8225-1f2dae4aac0e", "value": "n. 1) still or threshold. 2) inner sill with a socket."}
{"id": "b329a1ca-8f65-4742-a9ae-772fda4da7f6", "value": "n. anim swallow."}
{"id": "7155761e-794c-4f02-baa5-02959f0ecc92", "value": "[New.] var. gajuli, gag\u016b; n. pinnacle (specially of a temple). See s.v. kala\u015ba."}
{"id": "cf996323-d27b-4ce0-a296-8c2e4c8e2a9a", "value": "[New.] n. var. gha\u1e25m\u0101; shaft of a chariot."}
{"id": "de1db209-ca26-4a4a-8f65-131223e09495", "value": "n. chisel with rounded edge."}
{"id": "6e630844-0d1f-4360-831f-a4aeaa22d1c4", "value": "[S.], vernacular. bhicchu, bhikchu; a Buddhist mendicant or monk."}
{"id": "51b5d964-a4d1-4bb8-a529-0ae05f658d7f", "value": "n. candle."}
{"id": "1e030805-eb06-43ec-aead-bcef43ac1468", "value": "n. basket or metal pot."}
{"id": "e2b10378-86eb-4014-8d13-b77dc0000208", "value": "n. hammer headed joint."}

{"id": "3f10d7bb-a7a7-4110-878d-400d47be732c", "value": "[fr. S. ko\u1e63\u1e6dhap\u0101la] n. hon. principal deity of a Buddhist Monastery (see, s.v. kv\u0101\u1e25p\u0101\u1e25dya\u1e25 and kv\u0101cap\u0101laju)."}
{"id": "b5299ebd-4d58-4ee6-bd97-798416322b17", "value": "[S.] n. offering material blessed by a deity or reverend being."}
{"id": "ce5b8745-de25-47ad-abfa-8afde7f8ef9c", "value": "[New.]; n. see s.v. p\u0101trakhol\u0101."}
{"id": "694d3e5d-7a6b-4fcc-9857-b87baed5fd3e", "value": "n. tympanon without medalion."}
{"id": "085b285c-0445-416d-a150-7445fdb75dd1", "value": "n. a discus or sharp circular missile weapon (especially applied to the favourite weapon of Vi\u1e63\u1e47u)."}
{"id": "ee4b732b-54b9-4e84-8fa6-411c8ed2dc93", "value": "n. stone base of a pillar."}
{"id": "7707c673-443c-49bc-8e60-7838f1210c49", "value": "adj. absence or removal of fear."}

{"id": "4b83610e-7b72-4ada-8f09-ff0e941094b5", "value": "[S.] n. the characters written from left to right in which Sanskrit, Nep\u0101li and many other Indic languages are written. Gupt\u0101 script, beginning around 600 AD inspired N\u0101gar\u012b, \u015a\u0101rad\u0101, Tibetan and P\u0101li. N\u0101gar\u012b first appeared around 633 AD in north-west India. Once fully developed in around 11th century it became Devan\u0101gar\u012b. "}
{"id": "1fb983db-c7fd-42fa-902b-827ae9325e0b", "value": "[S.] adj. a posture opposite of \u0101l\u012b\u1e0dha, the left foot advanced and right drawn back."}
{"id": "9280c22f-412d-4dea-be0c-fb512ca33c34", "value": "n. large door, additional door (of a large door)."}

{"id": "970e78ed-050f-4857-9eba-65b286c102dc", "value": "[fr. S. da\u015b\u0101ha] var. dasai, da\u015bai; n. festival to worship the goddess Durg\u0101 as slayer of Mahi\u1e63\u0101sura (buffalo demon), held over the bright half of the autumn month of \u0100\u015bvina (ba\u1e0d\u0101dasai\u0303/mah\u0101dasai\u0303) and, on a smaller scale, over the bright half of the spring month of Caitra (caitedasai\u0303)."}

{"id": "20ee816e-25ba-45cb-bb70-7f534b172e9b", "value": "[S.] javal\u0101val\u012b; jval\u0101vali; n. a type of caitya with the circular frieze of flame motifs. The first structure of this type of caitya was built in 1831 at B\u0101punani, a courtyard near Hakh\u0101 in Patan (cf. Gutschow 1997, 278)."}
{"id": "6a9e1222-4b9d-4dd2-9fe8-3dbb1b7c4910", "value": "n. spirits, liquor."}
{"id": "62804a47-aadf-4a0f-804d-1474868ebb4f", "value": "[S.]; n. ceremonial bowl of brass or silver."}
{"id": "03d9d3cd-884c-4a4e-90eb-c3d08c7f24d0", "value": "[New.] n. var. dha\u1e25m\u0101; see s.v. dha\u1e25m\u0101."}

{"id": "93f3809b-d2f6-43b7-8783-e8ca56f144e1", "value": "n. sub-branch of a Buddhist monastery (b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25). According to Locke (1985, 9) kac\u0101-b\u0101\u1e25\u0101\u1e25 refers to a b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 whose sa\u1e45gha (the community) is not independent but considered a part of the sa\u1e45gha of the main b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 where initiations take place."}
{"id": "41d56d39-622f-459b-98c6-0d7af79dd445", "value": "n. rectangular house."}

{"id": "317572b3-70ab-498b-a927-ae0fc1ab5979", "value": "[S.] var. bhajan (in Nep.) n. lit. \"the act of sharing, partaking.\" 1) praising a revered being, such as a deity or a guru, by singing devotional hymns or songs. 2) devotional hymn or song for praising a revered being, such as a deity or a guru."}

{"id": "cafc18f8-0fe0-441f-af43-6d1fba625153", "value": "[New.] var. samaybaji, samhay n. set of ceremonial (ritual) foods including pulse balls, (black) soybeans, beaten rice mixed with puffed rice, spiced roasted meat prepared with vegetables and pickles (served as refreshment before a feast)."}
{"id": "8e22bff1-e307-45d7-b081-5bf6703e2421", "value": "n. cottonwool."}
{"id": "d647fd75-40ad-4155-823d-353c12cdab8b", "value": "[Fr. S. vajra] n. thunderbolt (ritual instrument)."}

{"id": "86b107f9-1af0-46c4-92e7-a7181ddb5358", "value": "n. B\u0101r\u0101h\u012bs are the carpenters of Bu\u1e45ga\u1e25dya\u1e25 or R\u0101to Matsyendran\u0101tha. There are other carpenter castes in Newar community like Sth\u0101pita, S\u0129ka\u1e25mi, \u015ailpak\u0101ra. But only B\u0101r\u0101h\u012bs have the right to construct the chariot. They also carry out the Digu P\u016bj\u0101 (the worship of lineage deity) of Bu\u1e45gadya\u1e25. The Digu P\u016bj\u0101 is observed for four consecutive days during the longest chariot festival of Nepal."}

{"id": "b466b9bc-0434-4358-9c47-6d4c2ddb609e", "value": "[Fr. S. m\u016blavih\u0101ra] n. a Buddhist monastery to which a separate or independent sa\u1e45gha is attached which performs its initiations at the concerned b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25. See, s.v. b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 and kac\u0101 b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25."}
{"id": "3a448f91-2bc4-4a13-a659-436e167105be", "value": "[New.] n. beaten rice."}
{"id": "f7d05019-9aa2-4c0e-a85c-b1931c9cfdde", "value": "[New.] var. capil\u0101ga\u1e25; n. small treasure box with a roof-shaped lid."}
{"id": "de4c6fd7-e3b9-43f4-9a78-d8da396d8c47", "value": "n. any wall of a house."}
{"id": "0bb76a78-e0d8-4230-b864-31f6b420c5c7", "value": "n. roof tile rebate."}
{"id": "45b77abf-4d1b-4e73-9a4a-5f11d28b8011", "value": "n. the marriage of a Newar maiden with a god who is in the form of a bel-fruit."}
{"id": "1c062ee3-a662-41eb-9cdd-e7143d63b879", "value": "n. wooden mortar (to beat rice)."}
{"id": "73677bfe-5c5c-44d7-b397-05b027835a0f", "value": "1) rebate (for panels). 2) wall between pillars."}
{"id": "f7def79d-3f25-448f-9bc4-149b53261fa7", "value": "See s.v. kakku."}
{"id": "20c08a59-455e-4058-a509-49ffccf689ee", "value": "[S.]; n. a hole in the ground or an altar, for receiving the fire for an oblation."}

{"id": "67b1c778-0a5e-4425-bd9b-600efa824b69", "value": "var. \u1e0d\u012b\u1e6d\u1e6dh\u0101, \u1e0di\u1e6dh\u0101; n. a civil servant ranking above a mukhiy\u0101 and lower than a subb\u0101 during R\u0101\u1e47\u0101 and \u015a\u0101ha period (cf. Stiller 1981, 379). According to Edwards (1975, 107), \u1e0di\u1e6d\u1e6dh\u0101s originally had been the judges who presided over the court in Kathmandu but later could serve in number of other offices, such as the Kaus\u012b, the H\u0101ttis\u0101ra or the Sadara Daphtarakh\u0101n\u0101 (cf. also Kumar 1967, 165 and M.C Regmi 1978, 226). However, it remains obscure that whether the \u1e0di\u1e6d\u1e6dh\u0101s played same role also during the Malla period or not. The Chronicle (NBhV, vol. II, 101) suggests that \u1e0di\u1e6d\u1e6dh\u0101s were given responsibility of the finance section of the royal court during the Malla period."}
{"id": "3e526342-30f7-4c6b-b3ce-df6051dc1e4c", "value": "n. window with three openings."}
{"id": "c13bf761-feef-40b9-8f03-aabdefc4f7a0", "value": "n. 1) upper part of the bell body. 2) neck."}
{"id": "c2d59792-ca46-43b4-bb2c-a3dff8360719", "value": "n. wooden frame for a large number of ceremonial wick lumps."}
{"id": "0ad39593-6dce-414a-b1fc-a812870e8e26", "value": "n. small door bolt from the lintel."}

{"id": "1a559f6d-170d-4825-9216-d9948d1c4b63", "value": "n. 1) a window with the image of Kum\u0101r\u012b, 2) a place in Mah\u0101p\u0101la named after such window which can be found in Bhelakhu B\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 (LAL0230)."}
{"id": "7666a889-12b9-4ef1-babd-38405c2522e5", "value": "n. 1) drinking water pot. 2) baluster (lit sater pot pattern)."}

{"id": "e4925bf4-8700-45f2-85ef-8ae4c222b736", "value": "[S.] var. bh\u016bmispar\u015bana-, bh\u016bmyakrama\u1e47a-mudr\u0101; n. the gesture of \u2018earth-touching\u2019. This gesture is performed by extending the right hand downwards to touch the ground with its fingerprints."}
{"id": "e6327253-d5f9-41a7-bd4c-c86a13c96f20", "value": "n. 1) base for adzing. 2) base for planing (edge of the door leaves)."}
{"id": "bf1a39b8-29c2-4243-a39d-7f220d096f7c", "value": "[fr. S. sthav\u012brap\u0101da]; n. see s.v. thap\u0101ju."}
{"id": "804301c9-18cb-49c0-9065-fd2b50e6069b", "value": "[New.] var. nan\u012b; n. courtyard "}
{"id": "e0b3f5a4-b441-4d14-9a28-3a274e253c9b", "value": "n. stick to give a notch to the roof tile."}
{"id": "37cefc4b-93ad-48cd-bc19-275c60207748", "value": "[S.] adj. posture, the right knee advanced, the left leg retracted. "}
{"id": "887072cf-1cb9-47fe-b874-4a2164a13023", "value": "n. lamp with an image of Ga\u1e47e\u015ba"}

skos:Concept.skos:scopeNote: {"id": "a2aa8549-dc03-46d3-98a4-6f0dcb2ed60c", "value": "a particular mode of sitting on the ground (a squatting position assumed by ascetics and Buddhists in meditation). See s.v. ardhaparya\u1e45ka."}

skos:Concept.skos:definition: {"id": "c84a8a7f-2b96-45bf-a60e-d15f4d075c42", "value": "n. canopy."}
{"id": "94c6cf69-847a-47c6-80e9-bf8cb6b4f6f0", "value": "n. 1) rainbow. 2) rainbow pattern (wood carving)."}

{"id": "2978acb7-7fea-455d-be52-f86acb60e054", "value": "[S.] n. The garbhag\u1e5bha is an elongated dome and is surmounted by the eyes on the harmik\u0101 and rings surmounted by the another small elongated caitya (cf. Locke 1985, 356)."}

{"id": "a8c57f74-e15f-422f-b5bd-5f7486caf38a", "value": "[S.] n. A group of \u201cEight Mother Goddesses\u201d most commonly consisting of Brahm\u0101\u1e47\u012b, Mahe\u015bvar\u012b, Kaum\u0101r\u012b, Vai\u1e63\u1e47av\u012b, V\u0101r\u0101h\u012b, Indr\u0101\u1e47\u012b, C\u0101mu\u1e47\u1e0d\u0101 and Mah\u0101lak\u1e63m\u012b. In contrast to the classic number of Seven Mother Goddesses (saptam\u0101t\u1e5bk\u0101) in India, a\u1e63\u1e6dam\u0101t\u1e5bk\u0101s are venerated in Nepal. As mentioned in Slusser (1998 vol. 2, 322), the Goddesses C\u0101mu\u1e47\u1e0d\u0101 and Mah\u0101lak\u1e63m\u012b have complex origins, where as rest of them are related to Brahm\u0101, \u015aiva, Kum\u0101ra, Vi\u1e63\u1e47u and Indra respectively. The a\u1e63\u1e6dam\u0101t\u1e5bk\u0101s in Nep\u0101l are taken as hitv\u0101dyo, meaning (according to Slusser 1998 vol. 2, 322) \u201cfierce or forbidding deities who except sacrifice\u201d."}
{"id": "e9d909e3-2581-4ebe-b41f-9524d0508351", "value": "n. 45-degree grillwork (window), key batten."}
{"id": "7faa5f4d-8ca5-4153-badd-dffb4f7d94ce", "value": "n. mane of a lion."}

{"id": "9004124b-3a1f-4c6b-9d7f-8ba5c778a5e2", "value": "[New.] var. p\u0101nju; n. priests of Bu\u1e45gadya\u1e25 (R\u0101to Matsyendran\u0101tha) who come from Bu\u1e45gamati and belong to the Vajr\u0101c\u0101rya caste"}
{"id": "7fbdd687-4e35-4f8e-9f9b-3815a9848c44", "value": "n. stove (charcoal)."}
{"id": "1c7d8fce-1acf-4de5-8e17-53835e8f7ff1", "value": "n. brick-kiln."}

{"id": "471751a9-c8f5-4284-871f-bf67dba3d9be", "value": "[fr. S \u0101rya] n. seniors/elders of a b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25. Mostly in the major b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25s, there are 10 \u0101jus locally known as Da\u015bap\u0101ramit\u0101 \u0100jus. When one of them passes away, the \u0101ju next in line replaces him while a new \u0101ju is inducted as the tenth \u0101ju. The induction of \u0101ju is done based on the seniority in terms of age. The senior-most \u0101ju has the responsibility of performing the daily rituals and all other worships at the \u0101ga\u0303 of the b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25."}
{"id": "65a9be96-bd9e-46a0-abe0-7d6b409c9784", "value": "n. rectangular house."}

{"id": "6aa78f30-7149-45af-a899-5144513fb4ac", "value": "Barahi (B\u0101r\u0101hi) are the carpenters of Bungadya\u1e25 or R\u0101to Machhindran\u0101th. There are other carpenter castes in Newar community like Sth\u0101pit, S\u0129ka\u1e25mi, \u015ailpak\u0101r. But only Barahi have the right to construct the chariot. They also carry out the Digu Puj\u0101 (the worship of lineage deity) of Bungadya\u1e25. The Digu Puj\u0101 is observed for four consecutive days during the longest chariot festival of Nepal."}

{"id": "7349d3ce-37ec-4ab0-9faa-f0c5d3081ccf", "value": "[F. S.] var. bah\u012br\u012b, bahira, bah\u012bl, bahi; n. type of Buddhist monastery. According to Locke (1985, 5), the structure of a bah\u012b is similar to the b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25s, but it has its own distinctive features. The bah\u012b is usually two storey-building of brick and wood structure. In comparison to the late Malla b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25s, the bah\u012bs have simpler structure with less ornamentation."}

{"id": "956a7001-9d29-44dc-a766-a3930fb77522", "value": "var. Bh\u012bma Ek\u0101da\u015b\u012b, Bhimy\u0101da\u015b\u012b; the eleventh day of the bright half of M\u0101gha is celebrated as Bh\u012bmasena Ek\u0101da\u015b\u012b. On this day, a special worship is offered to Bh\u012bmasena at Bh\u012bmasena Mandira located in Patan Durbar Square (LAL1380) and his statue is taken around Lalitpur and worshipped. "}
{"id": "13ed2daa-5fae-4563-9467-c2ec5c395efb", "value": "n. open roof, verandah or balcony."}
{"id": "1f298500-3665-45b0-838f-eac9988b7b7a", "value": "n. socket of a door or window."}
{"id": "5df69548-dbbd-4162-b633-25aca1070ab4", "value": "n. slotted batten (grillwork)."}
{"id": "17763e49-f73c-4f21-81fb-3e734e82d980", "value": "n. group of window openings (lit. open window)."}

{"id": "40ab104a-301e-4727-b12e-edbaeca0789c", "value": "[S.] n. the gesture of \u2018protection or fearlessness\u2019 also identified with the gesture of giving refuge. It is like the \u2018boon-granting\u2019 gesture in appearance, the palm held outwards and the fingers extending upwards, representing the Buddha\u2019s protection from all the fears of cyclic of birth."}

{"id": "11df5e9b-adf4-4fc7-8bf8-5ef67312de8f", "value": "[S.] n. 1) a funeral monument or Buddhist cenotaph. 2) a pyramidal column containing the ashes of deceased persons, sacred tree (esp. a religious fig-tree) growing on a mound, hall or temple or place of worship (esp. with, Buddhism and Jainism and generally containing a monument). An outstanding example of a classical caitya is the magnificent K\u0101rli Caitya-hall from the late 1st century BCE near Pune (Poona), in western India."}
{"id": "6cbf15f0-b350-4ca0-823f-00194f46a86d", "value": "[S.] n. a Buddhist Tantric rendering of the enlightened universe."}
{"id": "40e7b628-c5d0-4331-ac7c-422169aa1e7a", "value": "[f. S d\u012bk\u1e63\u0101] initiation"}
{"id": "e5c4c219-a766-4d2f-bda0-08248c8e6a01", "value": "[New.] var. libi\u1e43; n. 1) lace, 2) canopy, 3) frilled belt, 4) frilled belt pattern (carving or metal work)."}
{"id": "2f029d63-f742-4ebe-807a-a1e8374019fd", "value": "n. oval window."}
{"id": "06815441-a4a1-4235-ae93-dea731fc0c7d", "value": "n. blind window."}
{"id": "8f2f6a7a-8f2a-412b-bb2f-6e19487ffef4", "value": "n. pea pattern (carving or interlacing cane)."}
{"id": "b7ef06d8-a6a0-4c07-99ff-ca1f39877ace", "value": "n. iron dong (mod constr)."}
{"id": "75f59ced-1ef0-4237-b057-f74a763f0c47", "value": "var. gar\u0101la; n. wooden support for sawing lumber."}
{"id": "5c532116-b690-44cf-ba88-c56174e8000b", "value": "n. railing of a chariot."}
{"id": "67daaa64-8147-4149-a722-8d59f9cc60a4", "value": "[New.] var. kiki\u1e43p\u0101, kikampa; silver banner, silver or gold leaf that decorates the crown of a deity."}
{"id": "f9b3ebc5-6414-46f1-8911-b43d7d48f2ed", "value": "n. lamp (on a bamboo pole, erected in the month, K\u0101rttika of Vikrama Era)"}
{"id": "cfa9fab9-1825-40ef-a968-e532c3f4e29f", "value": "[S.]; n. ritual vessel filled with water."}

{"id": "b07b63e7-03ba-46f7-b3b9-0aa44462cf9c", "value": "[S.] n. the sacred plant ocimum basilicum, also known as holy basil said to have been produced from the hair of the goddess Tulas\u012b and held in veneration by the worshippers of Vi\u1e63\u1e47u."}
{"id": "ad084350-5895-4dfb-b592-e6d25e272883", "value": "n. round window."}
{"id": "de3cebac-3e5e-44c8-acda-a3bd169350b0", "value": "n. opening of end wall."}
{"id": "83d64a54-f6cf-4a22-ab71-6e33a44250ab", "value": "n. small cabinet above the inner window frame."}
{"id": "28c35173-802c-40d9-8fd6-be989071f9c9", "value": "n. 1) terrace wall. 2) railing of chaiot."}

{"id": "06356272-04b1-49af-b37b-b47d3528040e", "value": "[S.] var. mandir; n. a place where a deity is enshrined. Broadly speaking mandira (temple) is referred to a spiritual place where mainly Hindus, Buddhists or Jainas go to worship gods and perform ritual. Many Hindu temples are filled with wooden and stone arts such as, Pa\u015bupatin\u0101tha Temple in the Kathmandu Valley. It is the landmarks around which ancient arts, community, celebrations and economy were developed. "}
{"id": "d7fddd9f-d114-4d01-9eac-94e5ea3b9e7e", "value": "var. a\u0303l\u0101; wall plate."}
{"id": "aed7b6c6-d3f4-4fce-af52-5f1c4e46d5da", "value": "[S.] n. a type of caitya with four Buddhas in the cardinal directions. "}
{"id": "ef475bc5-f0ba-4bec-992d-fe8626c09411", "value": "vt. 1) to bake (bricks, earthen pots). 2) to cremate."}

{"id": "7a8fc1ab-3250-4f10-ad26-3f3698e5b8af", "value": "var. caukul\u0101\u0303, cvakul\u0101\u0303, ca-u-kul\u0101\u0303, cakul\u0101; n. 1) board to space a pair of pillars. 2) board between post and capital. 3) cornice above a window or door."}
{"id": "c28a7cc6-7dec-4902-bbbe-01f5cd28ca32", "value": "[S.]; n. a circle or crown of rays."}

{"id": "f2a56a8d-9a73-43e3-a1b2-c1c5475be3f5", "value": "[New.] var. phale, phalac\u0101; wayside shelter, one-storeyed building open towards the street for religious or social functions (see, KSND s.v. phalc\u0101 and Gutschow 1987, 57), for travellers, rest-house (cp. satta\u1e25). Phalc\u0101, which is little more than roofed rectangular platform, \u201cusually a lean-to in the towns, but free-standing along the trails\u201d (cf. Slusser 1998, vol. 1, 146)."}

{"id": "fdc321f0-2326-427a-b04f-2dcb95308820", "value": "[New.] n. a goblin or spirit that frightens people. This figure generally can be found painted on the wall, right-hand side of the main entrance of a temple in the Kathmandu Valley. For example, this can be observed at \u015avetabhairava temple located in Ikhalakhu and Khapi\u0303che\u0303 Bhairava temple located in Khapi\u0303che\u0303 \u1e6cola, Patan (see, LAL0100 and LAL1780). According to TDN (s.v. khy\u0101k) some people believe that k\u0101lo (black) khy\u0101ka is a bad spirit, whilst seto (white) khy\u0101ka is good one. "}
{"id": "367f6733-f44e-40ca-b9d3-3350ed645039", "value": "n. wall bracket (part of outer window or door frame with figural designs)."}
{"id": "00569fa8-9c4b-4d68-bdc4-518e2222d66e", "value": "var. tik\u0101jhy\u0101\u1e25; n. latticed window."}

{"id": "805ab6a5-9a7e-4d47-816b-7e68e393a99a", "value": "[fr. S sthav\u012brap\u0101da \u0101rya] n. the senior-most of a b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25. He is responsible for performing the daily rituals and all other worships at the \u0101ga\u0303 of the b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25. See s.v. \u0101ju."}
{"id": "3ccff77c-5d80-4d81-be1a-5de98ea183f8", "value": "n. end wall (without the right to have a window)"}
{"id": "45023c8c-94d7-4de2-ac57-6ae77f2b6249", "value": "n. vertical beam of a latticed window."}
{"id": "a8dd5c44-d8d0-4bb6-a7ae-2ace47740ff5", "value": "n. dried pea."}
{"id": "1b233abd-d1e8-4e87-bfe7-f599122e5bf9", "value": "n. diagonal latticework."}

{"id": "e3d30b96-09dc-4065-87c3-8b1b42214d9f", "value": "[Fr. S.] var. jv\u0101l\u0101nh\u0101yaka, jv\u0101l\u0101n\u0101yaka; n. ceremonial mirror encircled by flames. It is a symbol of prosperity and good fortune."}
{"id": "21013cdb-5109-4b5d-aaf1-a5b030990dad", "value": "n. house from which passage is provided to a courtyard."}
{"id": "7f548710-8f24-4c4b-bc63-2d91b145c03d", "value": "adj. unripe, unbaked."}
{"id": "15624b85-0dc7-40e9-a934-611b6fc38cad", "value": "n. processional route (around Kathmandu)."}
{"id": "c849d664-1900-46ab-bcce-939ae4e6c0a6", "value": "n. egg pattern (carving)."}
{"id": "4fa5add7-be47-4608-9178-933fc5ef6e1d", "value": "n. fire pit."}
{"id": "dc6fceaa-2a50-4511-9afa-5c4f914ab4cc", "value": "See, s.v. dha\u1e25m\u0101."}

{"id": "8fc754ec-8b4b-461d-ac38-9afb0d2f92dd", "value": "[New.] var. kv\u0101padya, kv\u0101b\u0101ju; n. principal deity of a Buddhist monastery (b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25). Excluding one exception (see, Locke 1985, 516) the kv\u0101\u1e25p\u0101\u1e25dya\u1e25 is always a non-tantric deity, usually an image of the Buddha such as, Ak\u1e63obhya, \u015a\u0101kyamuni, Maitreya etc. (cp. Gellner 2001, 137). "}
{"id": "0cd508bc-116d-45b8-8c59-9b4729bbd99c", "value": "n. mallet to compress and provide the size of the ruffian."}
{"id": "49de74ab-61c4-4e48-8362-143bbe47b5cf", "value": "See, s.v. bh\u016bmispar\u015bana."}
{"id": "0f4eeb6b-3a0d-4119-afb0-f1d59002052b", "value": "[New.] n. hon. principal deity of a Buddhist Monastery (see, s.v. kv\u0101\u1e25p\u0101\u1e25dya\u1e25)."}
{"id": "b77bd8a3-6f49-451d-8e5d-13d8db40bc9b", "value": "n. feast hall in a Buddhist monastery (b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25)."}
{"id": "f0998c77-fd30-4f90-8a68-916daf2eb17f", "value": "[New.] n. pagoda-shaped pot for keeping vermillion powder. It is usually depicted in a pair with jval\u0101nh\u0101yka\u0303."}

{"id": "bc7a90d2-51a0-4007-adb2-fe2225db5bc1", "value": "[S.] n. the gesture of \u2018boon-granting\u2019. This is performed with the palm held outwards and downwards, with all the fingers loosely outstretched or curved slightly inwards."}
{"id": "0bfd9c26-8b28-4e51-a173-7bc3c5e7c84e", "value": "n. rope line to hang clothes on."}
{"id": "ab555406-411f-4ae2-8b73-a63452d115b8", "value": "var. cukab\u0101h\u0101\u1e25dya\u1e25, cakv\u0101dya\u1e25; n. vernacular name of M\u012bnan\u0101tha."}

skos:ConceptScheme.dcterms:title: {"id": "96095294-19e5-4507-8b3f-e3d7b8c9ed8e", "value": "DANAM glossary"}

skos:Concept.skos:definition: {"id": "0d1ea81d-c9a8-4357-afff-967ce563daf1", "value": "See, s.v. tikijhy\u0101\u1e25."}
{"id": "07e07bd1-39fe-4e21-9a2b-dde24f404a9d", "value": "n. house with rooms giving on to each other."}
{"id": "4704a465-380d-4e10-991e-8dc1201f9cd2", "value": "[S.] var. toran; n. the ornamented arch of a door or gateway. "}
{"id": "45eb259e-4b55-4935-9c3d-6c1de871fa26", "value": "n. furnace of smith."}
{"id": "286f8d14-cd54-4dd4-a535-42cd0e21dfad", "value": "n. 1) perforated batten (latticed window)."}

{"id": "64135e91-bedf-418f-a31f-883304592dba", "value": "[Fr. S. agama] var. \u0101ga\u1e43che, \u0101gache, agache; n. shrine of esoteric clan deity. It is an inner sacred place, house or room accessible only to initiates. "}
{"id": "21b6efe5-8b6a-406b-80d0-caabcb5352bd", "value": "n. unbaked brick."}
{"id": "4f4a2f5a-5a6d-49a1-ae16-314b69234683", "value": "n. cornice brick with rounded moulding."}
{"id": "b8a756d4-7219-4fd7-bcf2-1d8673a5428d", "value": "n. foundation pile (mod constr)."}
{"id": "1d3c82a8-f754-4331-b5fa-10c4b5af20fb", "value": "See, s.v. \u0101lamata and matakala\u1e25."}
{"id": "12f269ea-ba73-4ef1-a789-d7a28105b7f5", "value": "n. the world, earth (generally 3 worlds are reckoned, see tri-bhuvana-and bhuvana-traya),but also 2 (see bhuvana-dvaya), or 7 or 14."}
{"id": "e678e20e-bdcb-4c1c-92f9-3b188aa2d067", "value": "n. arched window."}

{"id": "b506d829-e001-455c-a68e-8474a989b640", "value": "var. \u0101c\u0101\u1e25 luigu; n. The initiatory ritual in tantric Buddhism that formally makes a Vajr\u0101ch\u0101rya eligible for conducting secret tantric worships. It is called vajr\u0101c\u0101rya-abhi\u1e63eka in Sanskrit."}
{"id": "103b50ba-799b-40f7-a9a0-5080bded7908", "value": "[New.] var. n\u0101ga\u1e25, n\u0101\u1e25gvala; n. raised or embossed design of a snake usually found on caityas."}

{"id": "a243c374-a3bf-4e2a-a983-6676094e7cb3", "value": "[fr. S. vih\u0101ra] var. vah\u0101ra, b\u0101h\u0101ra, b\u0101h\u0101la, bah\u0101l, bah\u0101. b\u0101h\u0101; n. b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 (vih\u0101ra) is a Buddhist monastery, where Buddhist (supposedly celibate) monks or nun live. However, according to Locke (1985, 3) even before the Malla period by 1093 (NS 213) such Buddhist monasteries were inhabited by Vajr\u0101c\u0101ryas, master of Buddhist tantric traditions, who were most probably householders. In the context of the Kathmandu Valley, the term b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 refers to a building, an architectural structure inhabited by a sa\u1e45gha of initiated \u015a\u0101kyabhik\u1e63us and Vajr\u0101c\u0101ryas (Locke 1985, 4). Architecturally speaking, the Newar Buddhist monasteries are defined mainly by three crucial elements; a principal deity, caitya in front of the main deity and shrine of esoteric deity often placed upstairs in an enclosed room (cf. Gellner 2001, 137). "}
{"id": "5ed5cf88-de8c-40ca-86ed-e567e91d52fe", "value": "var. pas\u016bk\u0101jhy\u0101\u1e25; n. window with a row of five small openings"}

{"id": "61d1c66d-5d7c-4630-b47a-945dc6372418", "value": "[F. S. vajradh\u0101tuma\u1e47\u1e0dala] var. bajradh\u0101tuma\u0303\u1e0dala, bajradh\u0101tuma\u1e0da\u0303g\u016b; n. platform with a vajra design."}
{"id": "a2e5d5cc-f4f1-47e0-82a2-b058c63c2dff", "value": "[New.]; n. tapering of a st\u016bpa or ci\u0303bh\u0101\u1e25."}
{"id": "5ea076aa-148d-4c9f-a6e5-a3d6a8432f28", "value": "n. brace and bit."}
{"id": "b99121ef-bfd8-4217-8418-c490bf4b603f", "value": "n. 1) inner corner of a wall. 2) narrow place."}
{"id": "1487f275-c39e-47c0-a305-8fea6c76b8bd", "value": "n. decorative base of a chariot; stylized frill."}
{"id": "ff0656fa-a49a-47dc-8028-9c6d1d62af1d", "value": "var. \u0101rati, \u0101\u0303ti; lintel (with the socket of the door pin)."}
{"id": "a05abd19-e6bb-4cc3-a3c2-2c1e955caebb", "value": "n. base landing for a staircase."}
{"id": "036c83fc-ab3b-45ed-a7ce-038b4c64f074", "value": "n. first foundation stone."}
{"id": "c5022b30-6411-4d2d-bd28-89c8f5970a48", "value": "n. course of bricks without clay or concrete."}
{"id": "bf066593-afb0-453b-a7aa-f54ad5215b64", "value": "[Fr. S. agnima\u1e6dha] var. agi\u0303thala, agiga\u1e25; n. sacred eternal fire."}

skos:ConceptScheme.dcterms:description: {"id": "c2221029-52f6-47e6-8a65-d6781bcb1cf1", "value": "The glossary implies to the words and their meanings within DANAM"}

skos:Concept.skos:definition: {"id": "83dc558f-69b8-44c5-8fde-34875c8329ee", "value": "n. wood for chariot wheels."}
{"id": "2dcda3ad-132b-4a9f-89bf-95861e08a402", "value": "n. blackish clay (for bricks, post etc.)"}
{"id": "49b1a050-dff1-4059-b1ec-f0aeac221fb2", "value": "[F. S.] a little raised place where the sacred plant, ocimum basilicum (tulas\u012b) is grown for worship."}
{"id": "d8ff0258-2352-4fd8-8f03-dd2a713377a8", "value": "n. window with a row of three small openings"}

{"id": "ae1e48c0-2453-4dc7-9940-420ec8703da2", "value": "[S.] var. sa\u1e45gha; n. number of people or inhabitants living together. This term most commonly used to refer to the order of Buddhist monks and nuns. In the context of Newars in the Kathmandu Valley, each of the b\u0101h\u0101s is inhabited and tended by initiated householder \u015a\u0101kyabhik\u1e63us and Vajr\u0101c\u0101ryas, called Bare. They and their families constitute the sa\u1e45gha of their respective b\u0101h\u0101\u1e25 (cp. Locke 1985, 3)."}
{"id": "598ace93-877a-42f2-a9f4-e2d9aa8e1bbe", "value": "n. window with 45-degree grillwork (see also s.v. icik\u0101)."}
{"id": "bd175688-bc0f-417e-961a-2c4a07258d9c", "value": "n. earthen pot (for washing clothes)."}
{"id": "e8e194fd-5a67-4865-8736-07788b9ebc3d", "value": "[S.]; n. a musical instrument, a sort of small drum shaped like an hour-glass and held in one hand.\n"}

{"id": "bff6b230-9d58-41db-b1ef-e5efe922e5ab", "value": "[Fr. S. sattra] var. satta\u1e25, sattal, sattala, satagu\u0303; n. religious building (space for a feast or shelter). According to Slusser (1998, vol. 1, 146) satta\u1e25 is a third type of community shelter, other two being dharma\u015b\u0101l\u0101 and p\u0101\u1e6di. Satta\u1e25s are more specifically the community spaces of gu\u1e6dh\u012b associations, which are typically long, rectangular, two-storey buildings."}

{"id": "231b36c0-d851-4650-8eae-f6dfd0ea24b1", "value": "[New.] n. evil spirit in the shape of skeleton. This figure generally can be found painted on the wall, left-hand side of the main entrance of a temple in Kathmandu Valley. For example, this can be observed at \u015avetabhairava temple located in Ikhalakhu and Khapi\u0303che\u0303 Bhairava temple located in Khapi\u0303che\u0303 Tola, Patan (see, LAL0100 and LAL1780). "}
{"id": "bb643eb2-c970-4d67-8d1a-bbfb998f12bf", "value": "[fr. S. pa\u00f1cas\u016btrik\u0101]; n. ritual garland of five-colored thread worn during p\u016bj\u0101s."}
{"id": "5406ddfc-952b-4b6e-9097-8c43be1b20df", "value": "n. spacer for the plumb bob."}

{"id": "406aa133-25e2-40ec-96b2-0ce5623f9dae", "value": "[S.] n. word of blessing, can be used as apprecatio, in which case it means 'good fortune' (Pant and Pierce 1989: 12), can be used as a prefix to names of persons and gods, in which case it means 'venerable' or 'glorious' respectively. The number of \u015br\u012bs used varies, depending on context."}

{"id": "814dbf46-e1a5-4b7f-ba8a-9fe3d348fedd", "value": "The Buddhajayant\u012b, also known as Buddha P\u016br\u1e47im\u0101 and Buddha Day, is celebrated to commemorate the birth, enlightenment (Buddhahood), and death (parinirv\u0101n\u1e47a) of Gautama Buddha in the Ther\u0101v\u0101da or southern tradition. Lord \u015a\u0101kyamuni Buddha was born on the full-moon day of Vai\u015b\u0101kha (the first month of Vikrama era), got enlightenment on the same day in 588 BC and passed away on the same day in 543 BC. This auspicious day is, therefore, a trisamyoga (threefold blessed) and is celebrated to mark the birth anniversary, the day of enlightenment and the day of mah\u0101parinirv\u0101\u1e47a (demise) of Lord Sakymuni Buddha."}
{"id": "813855a7-446d-4970-8820-aa309b632e36", "value": "[New.] var. degala, degu; n. temple "}
{"id": "97b91c3b-1896-49ea-a632-5d2c4c3e63e4", "value": "n. header (brick)."}
{"id": "8526ebbb-d438-4b3d-81e8-dfabf875db14", "value": "vt. 1) to smear, to besmear. 2) to paint, to white-wash. 3) to apply oil or ointment."}
{"id": "5275d699-9b9e-491d-94f6-dabe02637f67", "value": "n. cornice brick."}
{"id": "58d0aeca-dcf2-44ae-8e2c-ac672f66751f", "value": "n. members of Vajr\u0101c\u0101rya caste who collect gold dust from goldsmiths."}

{"id": "b2f2b941-7a86-432e-965a-0329140d963d", "value": "[S.] n. serpent. In Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism, the n\u0101gas are divine, semi-divine deities, or a semi-divine race of half-human half-serpent beings that reside in the netherworld (p\u0101t\u0101la) or in the world of n\u0101gas (n\u0101galoka) and can occasionally take human form. They are principally depicted in three forms: wholly humans with snakes on the heads and necks; common serpents or as half-human half-snake beings. Vi\u1e63\u1e47u is originally portrayed in the form sheltered by \u015ae\u1e63an\u0101ga or reclining on \u015ae\u1e63a, but the iconography has been extended to other deities as well, e.g., \u015aiva is often shown garlanded with a snake and the serpent is a common feature in Ganesha iconography."}
{"id": "7cfccd85-6ae5-4ec7-84e3-12eac298cb63", "value": "n. private passage to a courtyard."}
{"id": "af947a83-c6d3-45c5-902f-e6b7458854a5", "value": "n. 1) window cornice. 2) stepped pattern (of cornice)."}
{"id": "1c627e6d-2ed6-4add-b429-647bd152267e", "value": "n. stone slab above the first foundation stone."}
{"id": "aefa2a4c-133c-4c33-87dc-d1a8e5e9dcf9", "value": "n. name of a caste engaged in stirring the cremation fire."}

skos:Concept.skos:scopeNote: {"id": "72d33db5-c5ad-4b42-a614-b68cbb405bb6", "value": "n. lit. \"dog's paw\", dog's paw pattern on the dhali\u0303mva\u1e25."}

skos:Concept.skos:definition: {"id": "c0d37e66-83c6-4b34-8d8e-72ee01bce8b1", "value": "[S.] var. \u015bikhar, sikhar, sikhara; this term, literally \"mountain peak\", refers to the rising tower in the Hindu temple architecture of North India and Nepal and also often used in Jain temples. "}
{"id": "df44447b-3b21-459d-9b06-aacdef6e7fbb", "value": "[New.] var. hi\u1e6di, hiti; n. spring of water or watering-place."}

{"id": "a324e594-c8d7-4529-8932-385a284c4335", "value": "[S.] n. \u015aiva's genital organ or \u015aiva worshiped in the form of a Phallus, this is usually of stone or marble, and set up in temples appropriated to \u015aiva."}
{"id": "60fcd79b-1103-4983-b9e7-7cc288370533", "value": "[fr. S. bhairavadeva] God Bhairava, the wrathful manifestation of lord \u015aiva."}
{"id": "a76dca3b-6bc2-4e47-aa17-8738edc86e5b", "value": "[New.] wayside stall or temporary shop (under a tree)."}
{"id": "7f196faa-c4fd-49e7-beaa-5a8f2e3149cf", "value": "the \u201chalf cross-legged\u201d posture (\u0101sana) practised in meditation. See s.v. parya\u1e45ka."}
{"id": "270efff3-965c-4c38-8242-54bbb4eaa783", "value": "[New.] var. ha\u0303khitala, hakhig\u016b; n. line on wood."}

{"id": "e760fb83-8005-4d20-8176-2bb372555df5", "value": "[fr. S \u0101gama]\tvar. \u0101gam; n. 1) inner sacred place for performing secret tantric rituals, room where an image of a secret deity is kept, accessible only to initiates, 2) mystery, secret."}
{"id": "b372bd28-5169-4d66-8904-289f2ff1bd33", "value": "n. bolt of a door."}
{"id": "1fb79bd3-61c3-4933-bd3b-d6b4a35d1525", "value": "n. three-legged straw figure (made on crossroads on the occasion of Gatg\u0101\u0303muga\u1e25 festival in August)."}

{"id": "cbb8ca45-49c2-420f-a749-403e1dbeb46a", "value": "[S.] var. kalasa, kalas; n. 1) a copper-gilt bell-shaped crescent on the top of a temple or tomb (see, TND s.v. kalas). 2) a copper or mud water-pot used in the performance of religious rites."}
{"id": "6c321ee6-7ac9-4beb-842d-31a3130df932", "value": "[F. S.] n. 1) frill 2) frill pattern (carving)."}
